intro: Hymenocarpos hamosus, commonly known as the hairy false sandcherry, is a small herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lythraceae, which includes plants such as poinsettias and water willows. The plant features small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Hymenocarpos hamosus thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
